visualization

Functions

plot.mean_CI(data, minsample=2)[source]¶

mean and CI of many time series

Parameters

data – 2D array. each row is one timeseries. each column is measurements of mutiple samples at the same time point

Returns

1d array of mean and CI

plot.centroid(cnt)[source]¶

find centroid of opencv contour :return: tuple(cX,cY)

plot.colormap(v, vmin, vmax, cmap='jet')[source]¶

convert number to rgb value using given colormap

Parameters

  • v (number or numpy array) – number to be converted

  • vmin/vmax (float) – bounds of colormap

  • cmap (str) – colormap name in Matplotlib

Returns

converted rgb array

Return type

np.uint8 array

Note

to convert 3D(Z,X,Y) array, iterate in Z to convert 2D(X,Y)

plot.crop_border(imstack, rect, value, top=2, bottom=2, left=2, right=2)[source]¶

crop and add border to imagestack

Parameters

  • imstack – np.array (Z,X,Y) or (Z,X,Y,3)

  • rect – crop rectangle [[z0,z1],[x0,x1],[y0,y1]]

  • value – int or RGB value to fill the border pixels

  • top,bottom,left,right – width and height of the border

plot.scalebar_timestamp(im, dt, fgc)[source]¶

add space scale bar and time stamp on imagestack

plot.color_excitation(traj, c, im, exc, newexc)[source]¶

color code different connected excitations

Parameters

  • traj – [(pz0,cnt0),(pz1,cnt1),…]

  • c – RGB color pair [newexc_color, exc_color]

  • im – RGB imagestack

  • exc,newexc – binary imagestack

plot.draw_circles(imstack, point, color, N, rlst)[source]¶

draw circle perimeter on RGB image stack

Parameters

  • imstack – np.array((Z,X,Y,3), np.uint8)

  • point – [z,x,y]

  • color – [R,G,B]

  • N – draw circle from frame z-N to frame z+N

  • radius – list of radius of circles

plot.hSV(rgb, channel=2, v=155)[source]¶

given rgb value, change its saturation and value in hsv mode
